      • getScreenBounds

        public final java.awt.Rectangle getScreenBounds()
        Specified by:
        getScreenBounds in class WindowManagerEx
        Returns:
        union of bounds of all default screen devices. Note that x and/or y coordinates can be negative. It depends on physical configuration of graphics devices. For example, the left monitor has negative coordinates on Win32 platform with dual monitor support (right monitor is the primer one) .

      • getScreenBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getScreenBounds(Project project)
        Specified by:
        getScreenBounds in class WindowManagerEx
        Returns:
        bounds for the screen device for the given project frame

      • isInsideScreenBounds

        public final boolean isInsideScreenBounds(int x,
                                          int y,
                                          int width)
        Description copied from class: WindowManager
        Tests whether the specified rectangle is inside of screen bounds.

        Method uses its own heuristic test. Test passes if the intersection of screen bounds and specified rectangle isn't empty and its height and width are not less than some value. Note, that all parameters are in screen coordinate system. The method properly works in a multi-monitor configuration.

        Specified by:
        isInsideScreenBounds in class WindowManager

      • isAlphaModeSupported

        public final boolean isAlphaModeSupported()
        Specified by:
        isAlphaModeSupported in class WindowManager
        Returns:
        true if current OS supports alpha mode for windows and all native libraries were successfully loaded.

      • setAlphaModeRatio

        public final void setAlphaModeRatio(java.awt.Window window,
                                    float ratio)
        Description copied from class: WindowManager
        Sets alpha (transparency) ratio for the specified window.

        If alpha mode isn't supported by the underlying windowing system, then the method does nothing. The method also does nothing if alpha mode isn't enabled for the specified window.

        Specified by:
        setAlphaModeRatio in class WindowManager
        Parameters:
        window - window which transparency should be changed.
        ratio - ratio of transparency. 0 means absolutely non transparent window. 1 means absolutely transparent window.

      • setAlphaModeEnabled

        public final void setAlphaModeEnabled(java.awt.Window window,
                                      boolean state)
        Description copied from class: WindowManager
        Sets whether the alpha (transparent) mode is enabled for specified window. If alpha mode isn't supported by the underlying windowing system, then the method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        setAlphaModeEnabled in class WindowManager
        Parameters:
        window - window which mode to be set.
        state - determines the new alpha mode.

      • suggestParentWindow

        public final java.awt.Window suggestParentWindow(Project project)
        Description copied from class: WindowManager
        Gets first window (starting from the active one) that can be the parent for other windows. Note, that this method returns only subclasses of Dialog or Frame.
        Specified by:
        suggestParentWindow in class WindowManager
        Returns:
        null if there is no currently active window or there is no window that can be the parent.

      • getFocusedComponent

        public final java.awt.Component getFocusedComponent(Project project)
        Specified by:
        getFocusedComponent in class WindowManagerEx
        Parameters:
        project - may be null when no project is opened.
        Returns:
        focused component for the project. If project isn't specified then the method returns focused component in window which has no project. If there is no focused component at all then the method returns null.

      • loadState

        public void loadState(Element state)
        Description copied from interface: PersistentStateComponent
        This method is called when new component state is loaded. The method can and will be called several times, if config files were externally changed while IDE was running.

        State object should be used directly, defensive copying is not required.

        Specified by:
        loadState in interface PersistentStateComponent<Element>
        Parameters:
        state - loaded component state
        See Also:
        XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(Object, Object)

      • getDefaultFrameInfo

      • getState

        public Element getState()
        Specified by:
        getState in interface PersistentStateComponent<Element>
        Returns:
        a component state. All properties, public and annotated fields are serialized. Only values, which differ from the default (i.e., the value of newly instantiated class) are serialized. null value indicates that the returned state won't be stored, as a result previously stored state will be used.
        See Also:
        XmlSerializer
